A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Really don’t understand the hate here. Hopefully this will be remembered in the same way Empire Strikes Back is - i.e. a similar amount of hate upon release\, but in time heralded as a masterpiece of storytelling. While this doesn’t warrant the same praise as said classic (yet)\, this is an incredibly strong entry in the Star Wars film universe. The strongest since Empire for sure. Great characterization\, you can feel the stakes rising at every turn\, and the film makes very bold and intelligent decisions all around. This is a film that doesn’t spoon-feed fandom the same archetypes and beats like Force Awakens. It doesn’t make goofy mistakes like Return of the Jedi or the Prequels. Everything approached dramatically\, it all sticks\, and it ADDS the lore; it DOES NOT belittle or step on it. I’m very much looking forward to what they do with Episode IX\, and I’m really stoked for Rian Johnson’s forthcoming stand-alone (non-Skywalker-centric) trilogy! It’s excellent.
